intro: Dryopria discolor, commonly known as the yellow false solomon's seal, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its slender, arching stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces berries that transition from green to red as they mature, adding visual interest in the fall. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly rough texture. Dryopria discolor thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
